data.title: CPS HR Consulting
data.text:
Public Affairs Manager

Imperial Irrigation District

Patrick Batten

Imperial Irrigation District has selected Patrick Batten to assume the role of Public Affairs Manager. Mr. Batten comes to the District previously serving as the Director of Public Affairs for Southwest Strategies. He will begin in his role on August 12, 2024.

City Manager

City of Arcata

Merritt Perry

City of Arcata has selected Merritt Perry to assume the role of City Manager. Mr. Perry comes to the City previously serving as the City Manager for City of Fortuna. Mr. Perry has sought and received millions of dollars in grant funds for the City of Fortuna and for other municipalities for which he has worked. He will begin in his role on August 1, 2024.

General Manager

Ironhouse Sanitary District

Jean-Marc Petit

Ironhouse Sanitary District has selected Jean-Marc Petit to assume the role of General Manager. Mr. Petit comes to the District previously serving as the Senior Project Manager and Wastewater Treatment Business Leader for HDR Engineering, Inc. Mr. Petit is an accomplished professional utility executive with more than 30 years of experience in operations, planning, design, construction, and technical leadership in the water/wastewater/recycled water field. He will begin in his role on July 22, 2024.

Human Resources Director

County of Ventura, CA

Danielle Keys

County of Ventura has selected Danielle Keys to assume the role of Human Resources Director. Ms. Keys comes to the County previously serving as the Director of Human Resources for City of San Buenaventura. Ms. Keys was responsible for full service Human Resources departments for over 600 employees and over 200 extra help employees. She will begin in her role on July 15, 2024.

Chief Financial Officer

County of Ventura, CA

Scott Powers

County of Ventura has selected Scott Powers to assume the role of Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Powers was previously serving as the Deputy Chief Financial Officer for the County. Mr. Powers has a proven track record in financial management and a 14-year tenure within the County Executive Officeâ€™s Budget and Finance Division. He will begin in his role on July 1, 2024.
